newsitem.title: INDIA: New India RBI policy holds down dlr forward premia.
newsitem.headline: New India RBI policy holds down dlr forward premia.

text.p: Forward dollar premia were quoted at 1.30/1.32 rupees for six months at mid session against Friday's close of 1.57/1.60 rupees and Tuesday's opening of 1.33/1.38 rupees.

The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) policy for the second half of the financial year 1996-97 (April-March) mapped out a staggered cut in banks' cash reserve ratio to 10 percent from 12 percent over the next four months. Those cuts will free up over 8.5 billion rupees ($2.4 billion) for banks to lend.
"The drop in premia is only because of this," said a dealer.

He said the market quoted 2/3 paise for October, 13/15 paise for November, 31/34 paise for December, 60/62 paise for January, 80/82 paise for February, 108/111 paise for March while April at 130/132 paise, down by 22 paise, from Friday's levels of 157/160 paise for six months.
